body.content: This app was created to be a living demonstration of my design and client-side coding skills.  The app is based on an extended version of the JSON Resume, with some additional fields ("projects" and "technologies") which I felt were missing from the original spec.  The app uses [SASS](http://sass-lang.com/) and [Bourbon](http://bourbon.io/) for CSS preprocessing, and the following 3rd-party Javascript libraries: [Browserify](http://browserify.org/), [marked](https://github.com/chjj/marked), [Zepto](http://zeptojs.com/) (a drop-in replacement for [jQuery](http://jquery.com/)) [loDash](https://lodash.com/) (instead of [Underscore](http://underscorejs.org/)), [Exoskeleton](http://exosjs.com/) (instead of [Backbone](http://backbonejs.org/)), [Backbone-Associations](http://dhruvaray.github.io/backbone-associations/), [React](http://facebook.github.io/), and [Flux](http://facebook.github.io/flux/).  It also uses a few Javascript modules I wrote myself: [searchGuesser](https://github.com/azaslavsky/searchGuesser), [sneakyBars](https://github.com/azaslavsky/sneakyBars), [backbone-hashMate](https://github.com/azaslavsky/backbone-hashMate).

If you'd like to use this app for your own resume, go ahead!  All of the relevant data is stored in three JSON files in the Github repository ([resume.json](https://github.com/azaslavsky/resume/blob/master/json/resume.json), [extra.json](https://github.com/azaslavsky/resume/blob/master/json/extra.json), and [copy.json](https://github.com/azaslavsky/resume/blob/master/json/copy.json)), so if you replace that information with your own, you should be good to go.  One request though - the repository is licensed under GPL v3, so please don't remove the copyright at the bottom of each page, and keep the license pop-up intact!  I worked hard on this - please don't take the work without proper attribution.

A truncated, more "traditional" version of this resume app may be accessed in several other formats.  It can be [viewed online](https://represent.io/alexzaslavsky), or downloaded as a [PDF](https://represent.io/alexzaslavsky.pdf). Since the data format for this app is loosely based on the JSON Resume schema, it only makes sense that it is available [in that format as well](http://registry.jsonresume.org/alexzaslavsky).  Finally, the entire JSON structure that populates this app with data is available in its [Github repository](https://github.com/azaslavsky/resume/tree/master/json).
I'm easy to find online, so feel free to get in touch via any one of the mediums [listed here](#page=about&contact).
